intro: Bulbostylis bodardii, commonly known as the African ricegrass, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, greenish-white flowers. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to thrive in wetland and marshy environments. Bulbostylis bodardii is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to seasonal flooding.
